paragraphs.text: Helping you achieve a beautiful smile — At Gill Orthodontics we believe every smile tells a story and we're here to help your smile shine with confidence. We are a family-oriented orthodontic practice serving patients ages six and up in a warm, welcoming environment. Using modern techniques and personalized treatment plans, we make orthodontic care affordable and comfortable for the whole family. Call to schedule a consultation with Dr. Jared Gill to learn how orthodontics can help you achieve a healthy, beautiful smile.

items.title: Family-Focused Care
items.text: We care for children and adults (ages six and up) in a warm, welcoming office where every patient feels respected.

items.title: Personalized Plans
items.text: Dr. Gill listens, then designs treatment plans that fit your lifestyle, goals, and budget.

items.title: Modern Options
items.text: We offer braces, Damon braces, and clear aligners with up-to-date clinical techniques and technology.

items.title: Easy Scheduling
items.text: Streamlined consultations and an online appointment-request make it simple to get started.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Jared Gill is an experienced orthodontist who enjoys creating confident smiles and guiding patients through every step of their treatment. He trained in dentistry and orthodontics and continues to pursue ongoing education to bring current, effective treatment options to his patients. Dr. Gill maintains memberships with the American Association of Orthodontists and the North Dakota Dental Association and participates in local study clubs to collaborate with other dental professionals. He lives in the Fargo area with his wife Katie and their four children and enjoys family time, reading, fishing, and community involvement.
We offer braces, clear aligners including Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, Damon braces, and custom retainers to meet a wide range of orthodontic needs.

testimonials.author: Stephanie Holscher
testimonials.testimonial: The staff is very friendly and helpful. Dr. Gill is very nice and very willing to work with you so you both feel good about the treatment. It's a very professional office but you can tell people are having fun too.

testimonials.author: Christa S
testimonials.testimonial: Dr. Gill is so patient with my young and nervous daughter. So appreciative for his gentle care.

testimonials.author: Melany Mendoza
testimonials.testimonial: I had an amazing experience at Gill Orthodontist's office! From the moment I walked in, the staff made me feel welcome and comfortable... My smile has never looked better, and I'm so grateful for the exceptional care I received. Highly recommend!

testimonials.author: Allan Larson
testimonials.testimonial: I just got my braces off today, and I couldn't be happier with the results! I'm so thankful to the whole team for making this journey such a positive one!

paragraphs.text: At Gill Orthodontics, we are committed to making orthodontic care positive and affordable for the whole family. Every patient is treated with respect and clear communication from their first visit.

Dr. Jared Gill and our team take the time to listen, answer questions, and design treatment plans that fit your lifestyle and budget. We offer both traditional braces and clear aligners to meet individual needs.
Our approach centers on thoughtful, conservative treatment planning supported by modern technology and continuing education so you receive contemporary, predictable care.
We maintain a welcoming, family-oriented practice with flexible scheduling and a focus on comfort, so patients of all ages can feel confident about their orthodontic experience.

I really enjoy practicing orthodontics. Creating smiles and watching patients gain confidence is deeply rewarding. I began working in orthodontics in the 11th grade making retainers and later worked in orthodontic labs while I completed my education.

My clinical approach combines science, art, and hands-on care. I stay active in continuing education and local study groups to bring the latest, evidence-based techniques to our practice and to help shorten treatment times when appropriate.

image.alt: Dr. Jared Gill smiling in his office

paragraphs.text: Undergraduate degree from Utah State University. Doctorate of Dental Medicine from Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland. Orthodontic specialty training completed at St. Barnabas Hospital in New York, where I received specialty credentials in orthodontics.
I participate in professional meetings and seminars at the local, state, and national levels to keep current with evolving orthodontic techniques and technology.
I live in West Fargo with my wife Katie and our four children. When I am not caring for patients, I enjoy reading, fishing, gardening, biking, and playing video games with my kids.
I am active in my children’s schools, support local education efforts, and participate regularly in my church and community activities.

og_meta.description: Learn about Dr. Jared Gill and the team at Gill Orthodontics. We provide family-centered, affordable orthodontic care with braces and clear aligners in Fargo.

paragraphs.text: At Gill Orthodontics, we're committed to making your orthodontic experience positive and affordable for the whole family. Your first visit begins with a friendly welcome, a conversation about your concerns and goals, and a thorough exam to assess tooth and jaw alignment.

During the appointment we may take diagnostic X-rays, review your medical history, and explain recommended treatment options such as braces or clear aligners. Dr. Gill and our team will answer your questions and help you understand the next steps in a clear, practical plan.
We accept most major insurance plans and will file your claims electronically to make billing simpler for you.
Flexible financing options are available. Call us at (701) 232-1500 or request an appointment online at https://www.gillbraces.com/appointment-request/ to discuss payment plans.

To help us provide safe, efficient care, please complete your health history and new patient information before your visit when possible. Completing forms ahead of time shortens check-in and lets us focus on your exam.

If you use our quick contact form, the site will prompt you when required fields are missing. Common validation messages include: "Please enter a name!", "Invalid Email Address", and "Email or Phone Required".

image.alt: Orthodontic treatment banner with smiling patients

paragraphs.text: Fixed braces use brackets bonded to each tooth with an archwire to guide teeth into alignment. They are a reliable option for many bite and spacing problems and can be metal or tooth-colored.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: The Damon system uses self-ligating brackets designed to reduce friction and may allow for more efficient tooth movement and fewer adjustments for some patients.

image.alt: Close-up of orthodontic brackets and archwire

paragraphs.text: Ceramic brackets match tooth color for a less noticeable appearance while providing the same orthodontic mechanics as traditional braces, though they may require extra care to avoid staining.

image.alt: Smiling patient with tooth-colored orthodontic appliance

paragraphs.text: Lingual braces are placed on the tongue side of the teeth so they are hidden from view. They offer a discreet option though they can require a period of adjustment for speech and tongue comfort.

image.alt: Orthodontic treatment patient smiling during appointment

paragraphs.text: Clear, removable aligners use 3D imaging and planned stages to move teeth with minimal visibility. Invisalign<sup>®</sup> lets you eat and brush normally while undergoing treatment when you are a suitable candidate.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligner being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: After active treatment, retainers help maintain tooth position while bone and tissues stabilize. We offer removable Hawley retainers and vacuum-formed (VFR) options with care instructions for longevity.

image.alt: Young woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Palatal expanders create additional room in the upper arch to address crowding and support proper tooth eruption. They can be removable or fixed depending on the case.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: Headgear and facemasks are removable appliances that work with braces to correct developmental issues such as overbites or underbites, often used in growing patients to guide jaw development.

image.alt: Teen patient smiling during orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: Find practical guidance on retainers, cleaning, and what to expect after orthodontic treatment from Gill Orthodontics.

This phase of treatment is critical. The hard work has been done, the braces are off and now it is tempting not to wear the retainer as often as the orthodontist recommends. Retainers are needed to give the muscles, tissues and bones time to stabilize the teeth in their new alignment. Failure to wear the retainer as directed can have regrettable consequences, such as teeth returning to their original position, added expense and lost time.

accordion.header: Don't eat while wearing a retainer

paragraphs.text: It can be difficult and awkward to eat while wearing a removable retainer and it can also damage the device. Food can get trapped around a Hawley retainer wire or underneath the palate, causing bad breath. When worn on the upper and lower arches simultaneously, VFR retainers do not allow the teeth to meet. This means that chewing is almost impossible.

Removable retainers can become breeding grounds for calculus and bacteria. It is essential to clean the inside and outside thoroughly as often as possible. Hawley retainers can be cleaned with a toothbrush. Because harsh bristles can damage the PVC surface of a VFR, denture cleaner or a specialized retainer cleaner is recommended for this type of device.

If you have any questions or concerns about retainers or post-treatment care, please contact our office at (701) 232-1500 or request an appointment online at https://www.gillbraces.com/appointment-request/.
